title: Ticket #2345: gahp_server consumes 100% CPU
description:
gahp_server.cpp contains the following at around line 1981: 

        for (;;) {
                globus_poll_blocking();
        }

In old globus versions, this would be somewhat equivalent to "sleep": the main thread would go off and handle whatever asynchronous event is in the queue.

For threaded flavors of Globus, this is equivalent to a spin-loop: globus_poll_blocking returns instantly as other threads handle asynchronous events.

Is it possible to detect the flavor at runtime?
remarks:
2011-Aug-04 16:27:02 by jfrey:
It appears we check for macro HAVE_PTHREAD. globus_config.h defines it only for threaded flavors, and I don't see any other places where it's defined.

2011-Aug-04 16:28:36 by jfrey:
Brian, can you try the patch I've attached to the ticket?

2011-Aug-09 10:45:46 by jfrey:
I have tested Brian's improved patch with both threaded and non-threaded Globus libraries.
